reviewText:
Product received for free

Fun puzzle game and I will let you guess which chess piece it's based on.  It gets deceptively more challenging as you go on starting with basic moves to match a knight with his square to straight up insanity as you start working your choices several moves ahead like you would in a normal chess match.

If you are looking for a fun challenging game you won't go wrong here.  For 1$ it is well worth the price.

reviewText:
KNIGHTS is a pretty simple puzzle game which requires a good amount of thinking.

It reminds me of those sliding puzzle games where you have to shift multiple pieces to move a piece to the correct position. This game does exactly that; you instead shift Knight Chess pieces around a small limited board into their respective color positions.

The further you progress, the harder the puzzle gets as you have to move away pieces which can be already fitted into the correct positions to allow movement for other pieces to complete the puzzle.

8/10

reviewText:
Product received for free


This appears to be  a puzzle game with a chess theme.
You're basically moving your Knight around the board trying to get it onto a particular square in order to solve the puzzle .
You start of easy with one blue knight and after solving a few puzzles the difficulty is ramped up and a red knight appears along with the blue knight.
You then have to try and move the red knight and blue knights  into the correct position.
Probably gets more difficult as the game goes on ,i haven't played long enough just yet to see how.

Nice relaxing puzzle game with easy on the eye graphics style.

reviewText: Knights is a simple game revolving around the Knight piece in chess. You must move the colored pieces into the corresponding squares. The game starts off easy, but gradually makes it more difficult, often requiring thinking and or trial and error. For $0.99, this game is a steal!!!\n\nFinal Rating: 8/10

reviewText: Incredibly simplistic premise that scales well to create a very challenging puzzle game. The lack of animation can create a bit of initial confusion for where the pieces are, but this is a minor hurdle that you get used to after a few levels.  Nice music, basic yet compitent art and solid puzzle design make Knights well worth the super discount price tag.  GG!

reviewText:
Product received for free

My video review for this game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SQpvsNkNfzk

KNIGHTS is an indie puzzle game built around the abilities of the knight from chess. While it looks like a chess game, it plays similar to a sliding puzzle in the sense that you make sequential moves and have to deal with spatial constraints.

The game features 82 levels, subdivided into 5 level packs:
- Pawn: 9 levels
- Rook: 12 levels
- Bishop: 16 levels
- Queen: 20 levels
- King: 25 levels

It took me about 6 hours to unlock everything, at the time of writing this review I have access to the daily levels and I still have 23 King levels left to do.

A very nice feature of this game is the fact that it offers new levels daily, which are randomly generated. However, the daily puzzles are only unlocked after beating the Queen level pack, which is relatively late in the game. The reason for this is the introduction of yellow ''obstacle'' knights in the Queen levels. I think that the unlocking of daily puzzles should occur after completing a few Queen levels, and not the whole pack.

The UI is minimalistic, which is nice, but could do with a few extras such as a redo button or an overlay to make some notes or scribbles on.

This is a nice puzzle game with a lot of playable levels and the price is fair. Absolutely a recommendation for anyone that is into puzzle games.

reviewText:
A fun little puzzle game with a simple mechanic that gets harder and harder.
Pros
-Easy to play, Hard to master puzzle type
-Nice simplistic visuals
-Nice soothing music and sounds
-A nice sense of satisfaction after beating each level
Cons
-Not easy to visualize how the pieces move. (No line showing how the piece got from point A to B)
-No individual volume control (The sounds of the pieces moving is the right volume, however the ambient music isn't. you can turn all sounds off but that's it.)
